subject: Re: [junit] Dependency Testing
msgSnippet: ... It s the right thing to do for unit tests but not for functional tests. After all, each method of our code is heavily dependent on the way it was invoked,
messageBody:
On Sun, Aug 16, 2009 at 8:46 PM, Mike Forsberg <bigmike@...> wrote:

> There should not be a whole series of
> steps that have to run in order to get a single test to pass.
>
It's the right thing to do for unit tests but not for functional tests.
After all, each method of our code is heavily dependent on the way it was
invoked, so it's not surprising to see this need arise in testing such
code. This is especially useful when the setup is convoluted and
time-consuming.

Dependent testing is especially useful for web testing, where each page is
tested in sequence and having tests that respect this dependency can save
you a lot of time and hassle.

--
***Cédric
